SEARCH
Package a02.project.com.GUI

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
a02.project.com.GUI.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
The `Controller` class is a JavaFX controller class that handles the user interface and logic for a Rubik's Cube application. It initializes the cube, updates the colors of the cube's faces, handles user input, and controls the timer for solving the cube. Fields: - `Cube11` to `Cube69`: Rectangles representing the individual cubes of the Rubik's Cube. - `inputField`: TextField for user input. - `timer`: Label for displaying the elapsed time. - `recentTime`: Label for displaying the most recent time. - `bestTime`: Label for displaying the best time. - `besttime`: Double variable for storing the best time. - `isInit`: Boolean variable to check if the cube has been initialized. - `cube3d`: 3D array of Rectangle objects representing the Rubik's Cube. - `timeline`: Timeline object for controlling the timer. - `seconds`: Double variable for storing the elapsed time in seconds. - `test`: VBox object representing the user interface.

  • Method Details

    • initializeCube

      public void initializeCube()
      Initializes a 3D array of Rectangle objects and assigns them to the corresponding rectangles in the JavaFX scene. Inputs: None Outputs: None

    • changeFaces

      public static void changeFaces(String[][][] newCube)
      Updates the colors of the rectangles in a Rubik's Cube based on the provided 3D array representation of the cube.
      Parameters:
      newCube - a 3D array representing the colors of the Rubik's Cube.

    • performInput

      public void performInput(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Takes user input from a text field, checks if it is a valid input, and performs corresponding actions based on the input.
      Parameters:
      event - The event triggered by the user's action.

    • checkInputString

      public static boolean checkInputString(String input)
      Checks if a given input string is valid according to give instructions.
      Parameters:
      input - The input string to be checked for validity.
      Returns:
      True if the input string is valid, false otherwise.

    • scrambleButton

      public void scrambleButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Initializes the Rubik's Cube, generates a random scramble sequence of 80 moves, and updates the colors of the cube's faces accordingly.
      Parameters:
      event - The event triggered by clicking the scramble button.

    • solveButton

      public void solveButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Calls the mainLoop("solve") method from the RubiksCube class to solve the cube. Finally, it updates the faces of the cube with the solved configuration.
      Parameters:
      event - The event object representing the button click.

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent key)
      Handles the event when a key is pressed. If the pressed key is the space key, it checks if a timeline is currently running. If a timeline is running, it stops the timer and resets it. If a timeline is not running, it starts the timer.
      Parameters:
      key - The key event object that represents the key press event.

    • start

      public void start(javafx.event.ActionEvent eventt)
      Starts a timer when a button is clicked. Initializes a timeline and updates a label with the elapsed time.
      Parameters:
      eventt - The event object representing the button click.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the timer in the Rubik's Cube application.

    • stopTimer

      public void stopTimer()
      Stops the timer, updates the best time if the current time is better, and displays the recent time.

    • startTButton

      public void startTButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Starts or stops a timer based on its current state. If the timer is already running, it will be stopped and reset. If the timer is not running, it will be started.
      Parameters:
      event - The event object representing the button click.

    • resetRecordButton

      public void resetRecordButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Resets the best time record to 0.0 and updates the corresponding label on the user interface.
      Parameters:
      event - The event object representing the button click.
